title: CN Level 8 — Small Office Network Design
concept: Scenario-based design for a small office: devices, topology, IP addressing.

challenges.question: For an office with 30 computers that needs Internet access, which of the following is the most appropriate basic topology?

options.A: All PCs connected in a ring directly with coaxial cable
options.B: ISP modem/router → switch(es) → PCs and Wi-Fi access point(s)
options.C: Each PC directly connected to the ISP modem via its own cable
options.D: Only a single Wi-Fi router with no switches and all PCs on Wi-Fi

challenges.explanation: A typical small office design uses an ISP router, one or more switches, and APs for wireless devices.

challenges.question: Which IPv4 addressing plan is most suitable for a single small office subnet with up to 30 devices?

options.A: Use public block 8.8.8.0/24 on all devices directly
options.B: Use private subnet 192.168.1.0/24 with DHCP from the router

challenges.explanation: A private /24 like 192.168.1.0/24 with the router acting as DHCP server is standard for small offices.

challenges.question: In a typical office, which devices are best connected via wired Ethernet instead of Wi-Fi?

options.A: Desktops and servers that require stable, high-throughput connections
options.D: All devices must be wireless by design

challenges.explanation: Wired Ethernet offers higher reliability and stable bandwidth, ideal for desktops and servers.

challenges.question: How can VLANs help when an office has Admin and Dev departments sharing the same physical switches?

options.B: VLANs logically separate traffic so Admin and Dev can be isolated while sharing hardware
options.C: VLANs remove the need for IP addressing
options.D: VLANs replace the need for routers entirely

challenges.explanation: VLANs logically segment networks on the same switches, improving isolation and security.

challenges.question: Which option is a common way to add WAN redundancy for high-availability Internet in a small office?

options.A: Use two different ISPs connected to a dual-WAN router with automatic failover
options.B: Use only Wi-Fi instead of wired connections
options.C: Increase the number of switches on the LAN

challenges.explanation: A dual-WAN router with two ISPs allows failover if one link goes down.
